headline: Marriott to launch three new hotels in Canada by 2030
summary: The W, JW Marriott, and an Autograph Collection properties are scheduled to open in 2028, 2029, and 2030, respectively.

headline: Why major hotels are growing their presence in Africa
summary: Driven by growing tourism, business travel, and a rising middle class, Africa is increasingly offering strong opportunities for hotel brands.

raw.headline: Why major hotels are growing their presence in Africa

headline: What's Next for "BEACH" Stocks Amid Travel Season Uncertainty
summary: With the summer season upon us, travel stocks are back in focus. For that reason, eToro built an equal-weight basket of BEACH stocks — which include companies in bookings, entertainment, airlines, cruises, and hotels. Over the past year, these stocks have outperformed global indices, observes Bret Kenwell, US investment analyst at eToro.

headline: 3 Reasons to Sell MAR and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Marriott currently trades at $277.60 per share and has shown little upside over the past six months, posting a middling return of 0.8%.
